_header: Spear and cross nail death and thorn
Note:
Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, no. 10100; Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, no. 13434a.
_description: Christ speaks of his sufferings — one couplet translating ‘Lancea crux claui mors spine quam toilleraui’ which precedes it in John Grimestone’s preaching notebook

NLS18721.Transcription:
Spere & cros nail detȝ & þornSchewen hou i bouthte
                    man þat was forlon
NLS18721.Editions:
Wilson,  Edward. 
             A Descriptive Index of the English Lyrics in John of Grimestone’s
                Preaching Book.
Medium Ævum Monographs
         n.s. 2. Oxford, 1973: 33.
